SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Product List Page 2.0: Efficiently Deliver a Customized User Experience

Show products on the Product List page more quickly, and customize more of the default Product List page user experience. The Product List page version 2.0 provides better performance and more built-in extension opportunities than the legacy version 1.0. A new custom object, CC Product Index, provides a flattened data source for rapidly populating product results.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

How: After you upgrade the available global data, the Product List page version 2.0 is enabled by default. A new configuration setting, Use Version 2.0, is available under the Product List module.

NOTE The Product List page version 2.0 is compatible only with the Bootstrap 3 interface.

B2B Commerce for Visualforce still supports version 1.0. To help you decide whether to start using version 2.0 and continue using version 1.0, review the considerations for upgrading the Product List page.

If you decide to start using version 2.0, first build a product index. The Product List page version 2.0 doesn't display any products until the product index is built. If you previously developed any subscriber code that extended the Product List page version 1.0, migrate your extensions to version 2.0.
If you decide to continue using version 1.0, change the value of the Use Version 2.0 configuration setting under the Product List module to FALSE.
Considerations for Upgrading to Product List Page Version 2.0
The Product List page version 2.0 offers several performance benefits compared to the legacy Product List page version 1.0. However, if you've extended or customized the default Product List page version 1.0, migrating to version 2.0 isn't a trivial project. Review the following considerations to help you decide whether migrating your extensions is worth the investment.
